newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila's Napocor 1997 Q1 net up 20 pct.
newsitem.headline: Manila's Napocor 1997 Q1 net up 20 pct.

text.p: State-owned National Power Corp (Napocor) said on Tuesday it posted 1.345 billion pesos in net income for the first quarter of the year, up 20 percent from 1.122 billion pesos in the same period in 1996.

Napocor president Guido Delgado said in a statement the company's gross revenues reached 17.339 billion pesos for the first three months this year, 25 percent more than the year-ago level of 13.914 billion pesos.
Delgado attributed the rise in profits to higher energy sales and lower interest expenses.
Delgado said energy sales of Napocor rose to 8,094 gigawatt-hours in the first quarter of this year from 7,705 a year earlier.
Interest expenses slid to 1.49 billion pesos for the first three months of the year from 1.60 billion in the same period last year due to the strengthening of the peso versus the dollar and the yen.
Delgado said the actual first quarter net income of Napocor was more than double its 623 million peso forecast.
A bill is currently being debated in Congress to sell up to 30 percent of Napocor.
